data.title: Very good lunch
data.text: Wife, daughter and I had lunch there, I had "The Pearl". This was a sandwich with hummus, avocado,  sliced apples, carrots and lettuce. While the flavors worked, the textures did not. The carrots were very tough and almost impossible to bite thru. Shredded carrots would have been better. Was still a good lunch.

data.title: Yum
data.text: Delicious sandwiches for either breakfast or lunch, great coffee, amazing cookies....particularly the lemon or chocolate-dipped macaroons.

data.title: Close to MIT - great food after tours
data.text: My daughter and I took a tour of MIT and this was the restaurant recommended by locals. The food is very very good. But it's also incredibly busy... And kind of a small place. At times there was no place to stand, much less sit. BUT... The food is good and the staff is kind.

data.title: Overpriced sandwiches and burnt coffee
data.text: Honestly there aren't many places around to eat, so I have been forced to consume here. First, all the server seem to be unfriendly all the time (maybe they don't pay them well). Thank god I've never found a piece of glove inside my food, but my friend did- inside a blueberry tart. This is a recurring problem, just skip the desserts. The sandwiches are blah, nothing spectacular just overpriced, they don't even know about the wonders of toasted bread. The soups are so watered down and the coffee beans are too roasted (caffeine is less when roasted)...The only good perk is the free internet and lounge area.

data.title: This is our "local" -- the place we go to hang out early and often
data.text: We *love* this Darwin's, one of three in Cambridge.  This one is our "local," what the Brits call their neighborhood pub, the place that knows us, where we go to hang out.  The breakfasts are stellar, perfect in every way.  The lunch sandwiches are 100% satisfying.  And, as a boomer with middle-aged hearing loss, I *really* appreciate that the staff keep the volume of the music really low on the customer side of the restaurant, so those of us there to talk with friends can actually hear what's being said.  We live around the corner from this Darwin's.  Lucky us!!

data.title: A favorite lunch spot
data.text: Huge, tasty sandwiches (many choices), fresh fruit and savory salads, always a few special sandwiches for the day. Add to that a great selection of drinks, chips and bakery items. Hard to go wrong here. Expect to wait 10-15 minutes for takeout during the busy lunch rush. You can also sit in the comfortable dining area.

data.title: Fun and funky sandwich and coffee shop
data.text:
Went here with friends who were giving me a tour of the Harvard campus.  Lots of people in a rather small space, moderately long line but it went quick.  

Sandwiches were fresh, handmade, and good.  Staff could have been a bit friendlier but it was in the middle of the lunch rush.

The quirky ambiance is a big part of the charm and overall experience.

data.title: Great coffee and sandwiches
data.text: This place is a bustling cafe and aptly popular. The coffee is good and the sandwiches are made to order and very tasty! I love this place for a quick coffee, to meet friends, work for a while, or grab lunch. It is popular much of the day, so if you want silence, this is not for you, but I like a little bustle, and the food and coffee are really good here.

data.title: Good Food ... Horrible Seating
data.text: Pretty good sandwich and hot chocolate. But most of the tables were taken up by coffee nesters with their laptops that have been there for hours. Had to eat our lunch on the bench or eat outside .. great for takeout .. not so much space to eat in. Had to order the food on one side and coffee on the other side ... I guess it adds to charm and efficiency?

data.title: Delicious sandwiches!
data.text: The place was packed and we had to wait a while to place the order but it was worth it! The sandwich was really good!

data.title: disappointing
data.text: All the hype just didn't add up for me: my Americano was awful, poor beans I expect, but just not good. The breakfast sandwich was average, no seasoning or anything remarkable and the bread on which it came was burnt. We were there for 10 minutes waiting for things to come up, but still no seating options. Not my kind of place.

data.title: Modern, cute, and tasty!
data.text: Popped in after exploring Cambridge with family, MIT museum left us needing caffeine. We all wanted something small and sweet to go with our espresso, and found a variety of delightful cookies. Must try the Florentine, simply delicious. Espresso came up quickly and was very strong. Love the modern atmosphere, wasn't too crowded or loud. Beautiful giant window with stools at the front, perfect for watching foot traffic go by.

data.title: Cozy place with great food.
data.text: Excellent breakfast sandwiches enjoyed by us all! I also had a fresh fruit salad that was delicious. The selection of coffees and teas is very good. The pepper jack bread was fabulous.  Friendly staff.

data.title: Hits the spot
data.text: Great variety of sandwiches on choice of breads, reasonable hot chocolate and coffee. Wifi and plugs to charge up. Clean bathroom. What more do you need?!

data.title: Good for breakfast
data.text: Great breakfast sandwiches and excellent croissants (both chocolate and almond are spectacular). Nice relaxed atmosphere.

data.title: Our Go-To Place
data.text: We live nearby. Darwin's sandwiches and sometimes soup bail us out when we need to pick up a meal to eat on the run. Always good. Ample. Love the laid back vibe. Can read the paper or do work (of you can snag a comfy chair--take it)!

data.title: Chilled spacious coffee shop
data.text: Curious about new breakfast spots, my girlfriend and I decided to try Darwin's. Immediately upon entering we noticed a great atmosphere. We checked out the breakfast menu and it looked delicious. When we ordered the waiter told us that there was going to be a 10min wait on the sandwiches, which was fine for us as we we weren't in a hurry. The sandwiches were delicious even though my girlfriend's sourdough sandwich was a little burned. Other than that a great experience.

data.title: Love this place
data.text: stumbled onto while in Cambridge for ten days of training and went almost every day for at least a coffee and to relax. Great baked goods, sandwiches,deli, fab coffee. A hidden gem off the beaten path.

data.title: Hidden away - I'm not telling you about it
data.text: Great coffee and a superb place to cave up and read the Sunday paper in peace. Sandwiches are very good and you could easily stretch you stay from morning coffee to lunch and beyond..

data.title: Sandwiches that keep you coming back
data.text:
Let me cut right through it and state what is most important: Darwin's sandwiches are among the best I have EVER eaten. Seriously, these sandwiches are good. Great flavors, top of the line ingredients, DELICIOUS. 

Here are my favorite sandwiches: Mermanwich (OMG), the Brattle, Pear & Brie, and Hubbard Park. (Note: some of these are "specials" meaning that they only appear on the menu once a week.)

Now, is Darwin's perfect? No. It is small very small, which is particularly frustrating when it is busy. There is nowhere to sit inside, and the employees sometimes rub me the wrong way.

But, here is my advice to you, if you work close-ish to Darwin's then stop by for a sandwich. If you want something to-go that will taste amazing then stop by for a sandwich. Finally, if it is a lovely day outside, stop by for a sandwich and enjoy it in one of Cambridge's many outside areas. 

In all seriousness, these sandwiches rock.
